visualization_prompt: Generate a spline chart showing urban temperature trends with seasonal variation using a 3-month moving average overlay

title.text: Seasonal Temperature Trends in Metro City (2023)

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two time series: 12 monthly temperature readings (μ=28.7°C, σ=4.8°C) and their smoothed moving averages. Synthetic values follow Northern Hemisphere seasonal patterns with summer peaks (July: 35.1°C) and winter lows (Jan: 22.1°C), generated using sinusoidal modeling with ±2°C random variation. The moving average applies a centered window to reduce high-frequency noise while preserving the underlying trend. The spline chart minimizes visual noise compared to standard line charts, adhering to Tufte's principles by maximizing data-ink ratio through subtle curve smoothing. Cairo's perceptual principles are implemented through: 1) Color contrast (blue actual vs orange trendline) 2) Layered z-index prioritization 3) Proportional marker scaling on hover. The dual encoding allows simultaneous analysis of raw measurements (volatility) and climatic patterns (gradual seasonal transition).
